I run a small business handmaking and selling upcycled clothing, my studio is a couple of blocks away from my flat so I spend most of my time there but will often pop back home for lunch (unless you're booking the entire flat, in which case I'll be away somewhere on holiday). I trade at vintage markets all over the UK and spend a lot of my weekends travelling far and wide selling my work, so you might find you have the place to yourself if you book over a weekend.

 As a creative person, how my home looks and feels is very important to me, I have redecorated every room myself, making it really comfortable, and hung lots of cool art of course! The previous tenant was also an artist and painted large murals all over the flat which I've made sure to keep and integrate with my own style. 

I use Air BnB all the time when I'm travelling with my business so I know what it takes to be a really good host. It's important to me that my guests feel like they can treat my place as if it's their own when they're staying with me. I've had permanent flat mates before so I'm used to sharing my space and love to spend my evenings chatting with house guests, but am also very comfortable leaving guests to themselves (like I sometimes prefer when traveling for work) because I know travelling can be quite exhausting and often we just need a quiet night in bed! 

I like to relax by painting/crafting, watching films or reading. I have a passion for sci-fi and fantasy fiction and tend to just devour books of that genre (feel free to borrow anything from my bookshelf when you stay with me). Also, if you like to spend the odd evening playing board games I have a few, and love to share a game night with guests.

I love Edinburgh and know loads of great places to go and things to do, if you stay with me I'll make sure you have the best local knowledge of the city, and can make the very most of your time here!

Also, I have a Spanish lesson every week so I can speak a little bit...por desgracia no estoy fluido pero, me gusta practicar!

Happy Booking,

Francesca x

i'm an Artist and Freelance producer / presenter of an upbeat environmental TV show for al jazeera english called "earthrise"  so do a lot of traveling.  I love my job - the best part is  meeting the wonderful, inspiring people that are doing all kinds of awesome environmental projects and having the chance to experience different cultures in a connected way that would be really difficult as a tourist.  Thats also why i love Airbnb - i often stay in hotels for shoots but much prefer the airbnb experience - i like meeting hosts, getting off the tourist trail and benefiting from a little local knowledge in order to get a better sense of a place. 

Some of my most memorable experiences so far have been cattle ranching in Mato Grosso, Brazil - Fungi Hunting in the Arctic, scuba diving in a futuristic fish farm in Baja California  and flying a cesna through a lightning storm over the Congo.

After living in London for years I  moved back to Edinburgh to do a MFA in Art , Space and Nature  at the Edinburgh College of Art  - so now spend most of my time making ecologically engaged artwork . You can find me on all the regular social media platforms and view all of my earthrise films online if you are into that kind of stuff.. 

Cheers! 

Russ :)

Hi
We are Lynne & Robert both Edinburgh born and although we both travelled for work and education, Edinburgh drew us back. We have lived in a number of flats in town so have a good knowledge of places to see and things to do around town.
We both enjoy travelling and are always happy to meet new people.

Greetings, 

The eyes of the world were firmly fixed upon “The Royal mile” recently when Queen Elizabeth died, and her coffin was marched up the Royal mile, to St Giles cathedral. 

My home truly is a part of Scottish history and I share it with you happily. 

I am one of the last generation of natives born and raised in the shadow of Edinburgh castle on the historic dastardly Royal Mile, who still has a residence here, and who call it HOME. 

As a teenager, I was briefly in service to The Queen working in the kitchens of Holyrood Palace before I followed my star to America, New York City to be exact checking in at the notorious Chelsea hotel, I fell in line with the downtown glitterati set and immersed myself in the nightlife. 

Encouraged to write by The Empress of Punk, Patti Smith after a chance meeting at cafe Figaro in the west village, Writing became my therapy.  

Eleven brutally beautiful winters later I washed up and thawed out on Miami’s south beach where I caught the eyes and ears of Music Mogul Desmond child who signed me to a publishing deal. I am fortunate to have enjoyed a career in the cutthroat music buisness for over twenty years, equipped with wit and wisdom undoubtedly due to my childhood as a wolf pup growing up on the unforgiving streets of the Immortal city, Edinburgh.

Passionate about making Art and mentoring anyone who wishes to lead an Artists life. I have risen from the gutter to the stars and am passionate about imparting what I have learned to anyone with an open heart. 

Rugby, Photography & Equestrian pursuits occupy my free time and use my Horse to heal my mind spirit and body after the death of my beloved father Rab. Salt of the earth. 

Edinburgh is a beguiling city of contrasts, revealing her secrets one whisper at a time. She is as interesting as she is beautiful. 

I am honored to share my residence with you, and hope it brings strength and peace to you on your journey through the greatest adventure of all... Life. 

Anything you need? just ask. 

Few people love Edinburgh more than I. 



My Life Motto is a song..   " Eye of the Tiger"  by

Hello I’m Mary, 
I’m a mother of five grown up children and currently five grandchildren. I live in a Georgian house which is on three levels. Myself and my husband live on the garden level, my son and his young family occupy the top floor. 
The ground floor which is exclusively for guests has two private rooms to the rear of the house overlooking the garden.

The house is situated in Newington area, which is close to Edinburgh University, Commonwealth Pool, Arthur’s Seat , Festival Theatre, Queens Hall, Meadows and Surgeons Hall . A 20minute walk ( 5 minutes on the bus) will take you to the historic Royal Mile , heart of the Old Town. 

There is a bus stop  a few metres from the house. There are several buses which will take you to many locations within Edinburgh. Airlink 100 bus from airport will bring you to Princes Street in 30 minutes where you can get number 31 to Minto street 

There is a great choice of cafes/bars/restaurants/supermarkets within walking distance of the house. 

I am a caring approachable person and a warm welcome awaits you.

Life motto:  Boihca!  ;)  No, seriously, one does not have only one life motto, one has many.
I have lived in Edinburgh since 2004 and I think it is a wonderful city with a lot of history.

As a sports coach I spend most of my life traveling from place to place, both overseas and within the U.K. Airbnb has provided a great platform for me to be able to travel with ease and to offer the same service to others through my own listing(s).

host_name: The Lane Hotel (Mark And Amy Kerr)
host_about: Mark and Amy opened The Lane Boutique Hotel in May 2017.  The Hotel is located in the south side of the city with amazing links to the city centre. In June 2018 they opened a Luxury Apartment locates begins The Lane to offer guests a new, alternative accommodation option. The Lane Apartment is stylish, luxurious and modern, offering guests everything they need when staying in the city.
Environmental student , Edinburgh Local , Retired Backpacker

I'm a married mother who has lived in Edinburgh my whole life so know all the best places to go and I'm happy to impart my knowledge to my guests. I love being part of the airbnb family  & provide a nice comfortable clean place to stay. Look forward to meeting you all soon.

I'm a retired primary teacher in my late 50's and have lived in Edinburgh for 35 years. I enjoy hosting and meeting guests from all over the world. I keep very active and am out most days playing tennis, golf, table tennis, walking and cycling.  In 'normal' times I go out regularly at night to pub quizzes, dancing to live bands and the occasional karaoke.  In other words, you won't see too much of me sitting at home.  Life's too short for that!
I am a very easy going female who happens to be gay, love my work and my dog.

I am an economics professor at the University of St Andrews. I have lived here with my wife (also a professor at the University) for the past 10 years - and we love it! This may be one of the most beautiful places on earth - and we are so fortunate to be able to spend most of our time here. We love to share our secret St Andrews with visitors - so stop by and discover our paradise.

Hey there , My name is Ali and I live and work in Edinburgh. I have lived here for 10 years after growing up on an island called Arran on the west coast of Scotland. I came to Edinburgh to become a designer and now design childrens' play areas as a day job.  Its pretty fulfilling but I spend my other time playing sport and travelling.  Its now time to  be a host so wish me luck in my next adventure.
I am a Professional Engineer who loves to travel. My favourite types of holidays are skiing and city breaks.

MYB is a consortium of property owners, that utilize their own properties at various times of the year, to ensure each owner retains availability of their properties they have opted to offer their properties as short stay rentals.
Each owner contributes directly to the management of MYB. With the owners involved directly in the day to day operations of MYB apartments you can be sure that any MYB Apartment offered is maintained and equipped to the highest level. We firmly believe that our apartments are the guests home / hotel, however We do not entertain social gatherings, birthday, hen, stag or any other form of parties. Our apartments are intended for the premier guests either family, business or tourists.  We cannot stress enough that we totally adverse to parties or any anti social activity and as such we do not normally allow bookings from Edinburgh nor do we normally entertain young singles, we reserve the right to cancel any booking that we have concerns with.

I am Lewis and come from Aberdeen, Scotland and have been living in Edinburgh since studying at university. I currently work as a civil engineer for an engineering consultancy, which I find interesting and challenging. Other work experience that I have had in the past is working at a 5 star luxury hotel, and from this I have learnt exactly the standard of service and hospitality that guests desire during their vacations. Which  is what I provide to all guests who book to stay at this property.

My personal interests include walking, cycling and  golfing all across Scotlands cities and the highlands. I also enjoy the festivals which Edinburgh has to offer throughout the year that I always take part in. Something else that enjoy is having a chat to all guests from a wide variety of cultures and providing them with advice or assistance on any matters that they would like to discuss.
We love to meet new people and always ready to help if we can we are friendly family...
Self employed and motivated to make sure all my guests enjoy their break in my apartments in the city centre of Edinburgh

Hello… I’m your host Bruce. Im from Scotland and currently living and working in Dubai. Have worked and lived abroad in many countries and passionate about traveling so I have a pretty good idea of what travellers are looking for when holidaying abroad. 
I would consider the following to be my main priorities when traveling; 
Location; easy access to all points of interest and to transport. I also prefer it to be situated in a peaceful area as I like my sleep.
Comfort; good beds, a decent shower and a pleasant place to hang out in when putting my feet up after a day sightseeing.
Cleanliness: I love a place that is clean and well maintained. Hygiene is very important to me when traveling (unless I am up jungle of course lol).
Facilities; wifi is essential and decent TV is appreciated too.
I believe my apartment meets all the above criteria that I myself expect when traveling. I’m sure you won’t be disappointed should you choose to be my guest.
I look forward to connecting with you as a host or traveller. I will do my best to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

Hi there, 
My name is Clare and I’m a busy Mum to three lovely children, Ila Eve, Gene and Joy. I’ve lived in Edinburgh for over 20 years now having originally moved here from Nottingham to complete my Honours Degree in Retail Business. 

Edinburgh is a great city with plenty of things to do and see. I take great pride in the accomodation I provide and hope it is enjoyed and appreciated by all the fabulous guests that stay in it.
Happy girl with two meows living in Edinburgh, one of beautiful cities in the world.

Hello!

Healthcare Professional

I am the world's #1 leading expert in helping women with endometriosis put their condition into remission naturally. I am an international multi-best selling author and the host of #1 endometriosis podcast.

Professional, hard working guy. You can call me Josh.

Hello!! A bit about us... We are both from the UK. I'm (Jenny) Scottish and Adrian is English and we've been living in New Zealand since 2006 but currently we're living in the UK. 

We love all things good in life particularly being on our bikes but also: sport, music, films, food, gardening, people....... Santa brought us a mini-Chamberlain for Christmas 2012. Fraser keeps us busy but we still look forward to meeting new people and always love having guests in our home.

Hi, my name is Karen, I’ve lived in Leith all my life and have a real love for this area. I enjoy socialising, spending time with son, extended family and friends. Young Irish professional living in Edinburgh, very social & outgoing. Happy to recommend good local restaurants, bars & activities during your trip!

Hello everyone and welcome to our listing! I would love to be your hosts. We know how difficult can be for a person to be in a different city, new food, new culture and new space. That is why we decided to offer a comfortable, modern and clean space for travelers and make them feel like home.

I also have a lovely 2 bedroom apartment in Edinburgh to rent. Any problems just text, call or email me. I'll sort the problem quickly for you.

Friendly professional guy. Like food, music, culture, walking and my dog, Max. Very relaxed and open minded, like all sorts of people. We are an Edinburgh born couple, who have been together since high school.

Born and bred in Scotland, now living in the Nordics. The apartment is our retreat when we come home to visit family and friends or to play golf during the winter. It’s been our little project for the past few months so I hope you enjoy visiting Edinburgh and staying in our abode. Was intended to be for my daughter however she wants to experience the full student life!!!

Edinburgh is an amazing city, but be sure to enjoy the wider benefits it has to offer like the amazing walking, climbing, golf, and indulging in the individual shops and cafes in the West End, Stockbridge and Morningside. 

Some of my recommendations:

- The apartment is close to the Water of Leith walkway. You can take an alternative tour through the city to Leith or to Balerno. It’s about a 20km from end to end, very relaxing and enjoyable walk.

- On Sundays, the Stockbridge market is amazing for foodies and just for browsing. 

- The Fox & Co eatery downstairs offers incredibly good food during the day at amazing prices. At night, restaurants like Otro just around the corner or our favourite, Locando De Gusti, an amazing Italian on Dalry Road nr Haymarket station is phenomenal (book well in advance). Others like Whiski Rooms is an incredibly interesting concept of food with matching whisky selections.

- For sports fans, you are in the right side of the city. You are close to both Murrayfield and Tynecastle, the home of quite frankly the greatest team to exist on earth

After many happy years living in Australia I have returned to my home town of Edinburgh with my Australian husband.  We live in Edinburgh's New Town and enjoy all it has to offer.  We love travelling too and look forward to hosting on Airbnb.
Someone Who Love Holiday & Believe in Spread Love All Over !!!

I am self employed though on January 2021 I decided to semi retire when my pension day came. Yes I look younger than my years many people overwhelmed when meeting me lol I say its the scottish water best in the world, it helps and recommend as a drink to anyone from the tap while visiting

I live in beautiful Edinburgh and enjoy skiing, cycling, hiking and good food.

We love hosting guests through airbnb and meeting people from other cultures. We do our best to help our guests have a wonderful  stay in Edinburgh, my home town.

My husband and I live in Edinburgh with our 2 sons who are at school.  We came to Edinburgh for university and haven't really left since, although we did live in Malta for a couple of years when the boys were babies!   
When we are on holiday we enjoy staying in self catering apartments as it offers the flexibility and gives you space which we find invaluable with family.  We try to make our apartments as comfortable as possible, with all the equipment you'd need at home, without too much burden on cleaning and housework!

Love getting to meet new people .

I have lived in Edinburgh all my life and while I am working abroad at the moment teaching English,  I am letting out my flat in Stockbridge, the best neighbourhood in Edinburgh with a village vibe but within walking distance of the city centre.  My family are managing the property for me while I am away and will make sure you have a great welcome to this lovely city!

Hey!

Hello,

I was educated in Edinburgh and love the city.  Since graduating I have lived throughout the UK and abroad but always kept my home in Edinburgh as it has a special place in my heart, I  hope you will enjoy Edinburgh and its attractions as much as I do.
As an Edinburgh local, I’m always happy to offer recommendations for places to eat, drink and explore to help you enjoy a memorable time in the city!

Hi there!

My name is John and I live here with my son Ben (here most of the time) and his brothers, Max and Oscar (here part of the time).  Whilst its neither a cottage nor especially SteamPunk themed, the name just summed up how I felt about the place when I first moved in.  The apartment benefits from tremendous views across the Meadows, giving it that country cottage feel from within the city.  And it has quirky design features, such as the ‘wood shed’ ensuite and the concrete and steel finished kitchen.  I hope you embrace its quirks and charm and enjoy staying here as we do living here. 

I moved to Edinburgh in 2015, having previously lived in the US (Boston, MA) for 8 years.  I began hosting my spare room, then co-hosting and now, I run a property management company specialising in short term lets.  In short, we look after other peoples Airbnb properties. 

I hope to welcome you to our own unique and happy home.
We are both professionals working a long day. We offer you our room in clean and beautiful house :)

Graduated from Edinburgh University and now living with my family in Edinburgh. I work in the tourist industry and run my own business. I travelled to many countries but Edinburgh is one of  the most beautiful and hospitable cities I have ever been.  I live across two countries and I hope everybody have a nice stay in the beautiful apartment in central Edinburgh.

Hello, I hope you will enjoy visiting South Queensferry as much as I enjoy living here !
I am happy sharing my home with visitors and this is a great location from which to access other parts of Scotland.

Walkers and cyclists will find that we are near the John Muir Way and convenient for the Fife Pilgrim Way and Fife Coastal Path. We are less than 10 minutes' walk from the stop  for the 747 airport bus (20 minutes by bus to the airport ) and only 2 minutes' walk from the stop for the Lothian No.43 bus , which makes the pleasant half-hour journey into the centre of Edinburgh several times each hour. We are close to the beautiful bridges across the River Forth.
South Queensferry has a picturesque , historic old town, complete with harbour, and a variety of friendly cafés and restaurants to enjoy.

I am 41yrs old currently living in beautiful Edinburgh. I am a social psychologist and a facilitator.

Work hard and play hard! I enjoy fitness and sports but have never shied away from a cosy night at home.  I was born and raised in this beautiful city but now reside in London for work. Hi,

Alongside our property, Lisa and I run a tour operator Bespoke Tours Scotland, so if you are looking to explore Scotland you are in good hands.  We are keen traveler's having traveled the US, Australia and parts of Europe in the past. We are now the proud parents of two energetic boys, but we do not believe the adventure should end there! We encourage families to come stay in our friendly family environment and explore Edinburgh and beyond. We understand the need for young minds to experience  all that the world has to offer and therefore set up Bespoke Tours Scotland where families could come stay and tour Scotland with us.

The living space is yours and is suited to families and groups of adults alike. Entertaining is not just our livelihood but our passion so you should feel assured that we will do our very best to ensure you enjoy your stay with us.

My name is Laura and I live in Edinburgh, Scotland. I work at Scotland's oldest auction house as Office Manager. Nestled in the centre of the medieval Old Town, our hostel is in the perfect location to reveal Edinburgh’s magical charm combined with an underground party scene unlike any other city.  Incredible sights such as Edinburgh Castle, the Scottish National Galleries and the Royal Mileare  just a short stroll away from your bed there’s no excuse not to get out and about! Our hostel is also a very convenient 2 minute walk from Waverley station.

From Edinburgh, Scotland. We are retired from education and health. We have two adult children, living away from home. Having had some great airbnb experiences ourselves, we thought we'd give it a go and found that we really enjoy having guests from around the world. This will be our 10th summer!

I split my time between Kerry in Ireland and Edinburgh, Scotland. Edinburgh is home but have been spending more time in Kerry recently. I love the outdoors, with activies on sea and land demanding equal time, such as surfing and SUP-ing and long relaxing walks being among favourite passtimes. 

Edinburgh is an amazing city to live in and visit and not just for the world-famous festival in August. There is as much to do as you want, whether it's visiting museums, the castle and other famous attractions, or taking a hike up Arthur's Seat, Edinburgh's city-centre volcano!

Hello! I am a friendly Scot who has lived here in Edinburgh for over 25 years so I am well qualified to share top tips! That said, I love that I am still discovering more hidden gems all the time.  When I bought my beloved flat it was on the edge of what might be considered City Centre, but certainly now there is no doubting it's ideal location.  It enables me to make the most of all the things I love, like culture, theatre, cinema, etc, as well as eating and drinking in great cafes and restaurants. Then there are the shops: both big name ones up at St James Quarter, and quirky independent ones on Leith Walk.

Welcome to our brand spanking new hostel in the heart of Edinburgh Old Town. Whether you're wanting the ultimate social backpacker experience or if you're looking for a more private stay in the heart of Edinburgh - our new hostel really does cater for all kinds of backpackers needs!  With incredible sights such as Edinburgh Castle, the Scottish National Galleries, Arthurs Seat and the Royal Mile just a short stroll away from your bed, our location couldn’t be more convenient for you to get out and about! We're also a very convenient 2 minute walk from Waverley station.

With over 140 new beds, we offer dorm rooms, private ensuite rooms and female-only dorm rooms. Our comfy POD beds come complete with personal plug sockets, a reading light and a privacy curtain. One special feature of our brand new hostel is The Safe Room; what was once a huge working secret safe has now been transformed into a spacious private ensuite just for you! 

With the new hostel comes a brand new Belushi's Bar! So be sure to make the most of the exclusive 25% food discounts and awesome daily drinks deals for hostel guests. If you’re after a party we have pub crawls running every night from our 24hr reception so finding new backpacker friends before taking on Edinburgh’s renowned party scene couldn't be easier! For just £4 a day you can cure that hangover with a full continental breakfast from 7:30am-10am.

Breakfast and all tours, pub crawls and city walking tours can be booked with our awesome reception team!

Hi, I'm Ben and I am based in the Cotswolds, England. Ever since I was a young boy, my family have been regular visitors to Cornwall and Devon. I now own a small travel company called Sand and Stone Escapes (formerly Beachspoke) that represents a collection of uniquely curated holiday homes inspired by our love of travel and design. Each one reflects the amazing locations in which they reside and have been built and designed either by me, my mother or a like-minded owner we represent. 

A short break is rare for most these days, but when given the chance, my favourite thing to do is to hop in the car to Cornwall with my wife and our friendly Greek mongrel, Tiko, for a few days of walks by the sea, amazing food in the local restaurants and cosy nights in with a movie and a glass of wine. 

We believe a holiday home should have all the perks of a small boutique hotel and have ensured that all the properties are equipped with small luxuries from fluffy bathrobes to a bottle of sparkling wine or Champagne in the fridge for your arrival. We are always on hand to assist should you need but would never disturb you otherwise.

We hope you enjoy these hideaways and the places where they reside as much as we do. Please don't hesitate to get in touch if you have any questions about any of the properties or the locations, we are always happy to help!

Like Rumi said, come, whoever you are, come..

I am a person who is always happy to meet with different cultures and learn from them. My house is always open for new experiences.

Born and raised in Edinburgh, guess I'm a local! Rent my Flat in the city as I live between East Lothian and Edinburgh. It's nicely furnished as a home and has lots of added comforts. A traditional tenement flat with period features  and modern furnishings.

53 going on 21, I am obsessed with 80's music and culture, still have a BMX bike that I ride, and if a John Hughes film is on the TV, count me in!
I am game for anything and I genuinely think I am immortal. There can be only one?
Anything with wheels is my thing, the faster the better, and two is always better than four!
I am a Consumer Champion and Monday to Friday I fight for the little guy and those without a voice!

Hi, my name is Charlie! I have worked in the hospitality sector in Scotland for 8 years. I have experienced many different areas of the tourist Industry within Edinburgh. I am very passionate about what I do! 

As a host I enjoy meeting visitors of all nationalities. I take great pride in welcoming you to my beautiful home city of Edinburgh. I love this city and I'm sure you will too. There is so much to do from sightseeing in the Old towns rich heritage or visiting some of the fabulous eateries on your door step.  

My favourite things to do are play Scotlands stunning golf courses as-well as skiing around the world!
I have a production company and produce live entertainment shows, mostly comedy

Hey, we're Drew and Tom, a married couple living in beautiful Edinburgh. 

We are very easy going and look forward to welcoming people to our flat - not to mention the wonderful city of Edinburgh. 

If you have any questions at all please feel free to email us. We love to tell people about the bars, clubs, restaurant and tourists attractions that the city has to offer.

Hi! My name is Pako. 
Welcome to my lovely artsy apartment.
You’ll be sharing the flat with me.
I’m an easy going and chilled lad. 
Mostly Into art, music and food.
I love meeting new people from all around and share experiences.
I was a tour guide in Scotland for sometime so ask out for some recommendations.
I’m always happy to help.

At GuestReady, we're on a mission to redefine modern hospitality. We specialise in helping hosts deliver outstanding experiences to their guests worldwide. With years of hospitality experience, we're dedicated to providing an exceptional experience. Let us help you find the perfect place for an unforgettable stay!

Hi there! We are Rebecca & Nathaniel,  a couple that base in Australia but would stay in Edinburgh from time to time! Love travelling, passionate in interior design and architectural design. Since we are mostly away, we provide security self-check in and our co-host/ friend Lily will be here for you!

Hello, 

Welcome to Edinburgh and thank you for your interest in staying at my flat. 

I was born, raised and lived in Edinburgh for most of my 28 years and previously worked in the tourist information centre and in various venues at the Edinburgh festival so would be delighted to advise you on all things Edinburgh or Scotland. 

I'm pretty relaxed and introverted so will mostly stay out of your way, but very happy to be approached should you have questions about the flat or are looking for info and recommendations. 

I can speak Spanish to a reasonable degree. 

I'm active sportswise (football, cycling, trail running, squash, pilates) and also enjoy reading, films, getting out in nature and attempting to grow food in my garden.

host_name: Emma And Max Pass The Keys
host_about:
Hi. We're Emma and Max. We have chosen the award-winning property management company Pass the Keys® to manage our home to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.

Pass the Keys® provides a hotel standard of service for short-let properties like ours. That means the property is professionally maintained and cleaned. You will sleep and stay knowing they guarantee professionally cleaned linens and toiletries. They also provide 24/7 guest support and local personal service before and during your stay.

Of course, Pass the Keys® personally inspects the property and certifies our home has met the Pass the Keys® Property Readiness Standard.

Our home is your home - welcome!

Hello, 
My occupation is publican/chef,I operate a restaurant/bar in edinburgh ,
 I play Golf , enjoy eating out , socialising, 
 I have many contacts and can help with booking/recommending restaurants,etc,
If Golf is a requirement i am delighted to help book Tee times and can advise on many courses. I am always contactable by phone during your stay, I also have a maintenance engineer if any problems should arise throughout my home.

We are your professional property manager that cares about giving the best guest experience: that’s why our friendly, round-the-clock Support Team is here to help! We’ll tell you everything you need to know before check-in, and answer any questions during your stay.
Sharing the love of my little, beautiful Stockbridge home
I work in fine dining so know the things that make a good guest experience, nice linen, handmade ceramics and bonus, extra friendly cat as well as good coffee on hand and a comfy stylish setting.
I'm a 30 yo professional who works and lives in Edinburgh. I rent out my flat when I'm not there.
Full time scientist with a spare room available in quiet residential backstreet of Edinburgh.

Hi, my name is Louise.
Im travelling with hubby Darrell and dogs.
We are from Edinburgh and are also hosts on airbnb.
Hello! I'm a 40 something hospitality professional, recently returned to Edinburgh after 20 years enjoying the wonders of Vancouver BC.
Respectful, clean, considerate and an explorer! Usually travelling with friends and family

Hi. I'm Jacqui. I have chosen the award-winning property management company Pass the Keys® to manage my home to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.

Pass the Keys® provides a hotel standard of service for short-let properties like mine. That means the property is professionally maintained and cleaned. You will sleep and stay knowing they guarantee professionally cleaned linens and toiletries. They also provide 24/7 guest support and local personal service before and during your stay.

Of course, Pass the Keys® personally inspects the property and certifies my home has met the Pass the Keys® Property Readiness Standard.

My home is your home - welcome!
I won't be around in person however Pass the Keys®, my property management team, will be available 24/7 via Airbnb, email, or phone (do not text, please call) to provide any assistance you may need.

Loves photography, cooking, mountain biking, walking, Skiing, travelling, spending time with family and friends. As well as learning about new cultures and learning new languages. You can also find out more on my IG page:- elcallanderairbnb22
I'm an engineer/bicycle mechanic from Edinburgh. I like mountain biking, travelling, nature and meeting new people. English is my native language, but I can also speak some French.
Friendly, relaxed, keep to myself but also enjoy a conversation. Edinburgh native, and have worked in hotels for years so if you need advice on where to go or what to do while here, let me know
Living in London now but regularly travel back to Edinburgh to see family and friends. Love to travel with my husband and son, we always prefer a home from home than hotels!
I am originally from Coloado, USA but now live in Scotland. I love good food, trying new things, and my family!

I am Scottish but have lived abroad a lot. I love exploring other places and so enjoy meeting people who are doing the same in my country. If you'd like some inside information about what's going on in Edinburgh, or where to visit in this beautiful country, I'd be more than happy to help.

I’m a Canadian but have lived in Scotland for seven years! 

I enjoy exploring the world and learning something new everywhere I go!

Mark & Bill are Professional guys who enjoy traveling and also hosting guests. 
LGBTQIA Safe home to stay. 
We have a spacious Kingsize bed en-suite room, within our apartment, that includes all the necessary luxuries for you to enjoy your stay. 
15 mins from the main City Attractions. 
Amazing choices for Breakfast included, served by your hosts.

At home/ in house services are not permitted within our premises.

28 year old fun loving Scotsman. Passionate about bicycling and the environment. Young professional, working in the Scottish energy sector 

Enjoy living in beautiful Edinburgh within a traditional sandstone tenement flat.

Hi I'm Murray from Edinburgh, Scotland. 

I own and manage several properties in Edinburgh and have done so for many years.

I have travelled extensively and stayed in Air BnB properties throughout the world.

Hello I’m Martha. I’m 32 and live in Edinburgh, Scotland. 

I love to travel and have had lots of wonderful Airbnb stays over the years and now I also enjoy hosting guests in my own home too :)

Scotland, especially Edinburgh, stole my heart and therefore I decided to settle down here over 10 years ago, but I also love travelling and this is when I make my flat available. 

I love counting miles with my campervan. I have done the Route 500 many times and I am always looking forward to the next one!

I am happy to answer your questions during your stay.

I hope you have an amazing stay in Edinburgh! Enjoy
Property Management Company
From Edinburgh, Scotland. We love exploring european cities with our two daughters.

I'm an academic based in Edinburgh. Originally from Kent but lived in Brussels and Barcelona before settling here in Scotland. Enjoy music, science fiction, philosophy, cycling, running, stand-up comedy, cooking, art galleries, board games.
Grace & Christian's place

Having enjoyed travelling myself I have an understanding of what your needs are when visiting our properties. I enjoy making comfortable, well equipped properties available for short stays, providing autonomy and comfort. I manage both our own and other owners' properties throughout the country.  As well as creating comfort and autonomy I also believe that good communication is vital for a positive experience. I am always looking for ways to improve so do let me have your feedback or if you have any queries do please ask.

We are your professional property manager that cares about giving the best guest experience: that’s why our friendly, round-the-clock Support Team is here to help! We’ll tell you everything you need to know before check-in, and answer any questions during your stay.
33 year old quantity surveyor from Edinburgh, looking to travel the world!

Marianne and David are a local couple with two teenage daughters enjoying all that the wonderful city of Edinburgh has to offer. David is a professional Jazz musician (you might catch him playing in the Jazz Bar on Chambers Street) and Marianne is a music teacher. We love to travel and experience new cities and will will endeavour to make your stay as enjoyable as possible with our local knowledge.
I work and live in Edinburgh. I love to travel, discover new places and meet new people. I also enjoy, film and music.

I’m an easy going and laid back guy who loves travelling and spending time with others who share this passion.
I really enjoy meeting people from all over the world and helping them to have a truly memorable trip to Edinburgh.
Being a fellow traveller myself, I’m a passionate Airbnb host and I look forward to welcoming you to my home city of Edinburgh here in Scotland! :o)
Friendly family ! :)

Hey , I am Ania, a long term member of hosting community who loves meeting new people. 

I work from home and travel often all around Scotland both for work and leisure so can recommend places to visit.

I'm Ronan. I love to travel so much I do it as a job!! also love cycling and skiing on snow and water.
Great coffee, food and drink are what get me going. I've got a cat, he's called Bertie, he says hi.

Lovely to meet you! I’m Maria and I was born in Scotland. I have lived in Edinburgh for years, having moved here for university initially. I can provide any help with your travel to Edinburgh and across Scotland if you wish to explore! Feel free to ask any questions
Happy, enjoing the life person. Would like to travel the world meet deferent cultures. Im easy going person.
Hi, I’m Bethan. I’m a nurse working for NHS Lothian, I’m a relaxed, quiet yet sociable person. When not working I spend my time gardening, reading, bingeing Netflix or exploring Edinburgh.
Mature (early 60s), semi retired and live in Edinburgh with partner and one small dog.

At GuestReady, we're on a mission to redefine modern hospitality. We specialise in helping hosts deliver outstanding experiences to their guests worldwide. With years of hospitality experience, we're dedicated to providing an exceptional experience. Let us help you find the perfect place for an unforgettable stay!

Hi, I’m Vitalijs! I rent out my property while I’m away. It’s a cosy and stylish place, perfect for relaxing after exploring beautiful Edinburgh. I’m always happy to answer any questions and help make your stay as smooth and enjoyable as possible.
Property professional. I travel a lot with work

Hello! I’m Morag! I’m a PhD student who loves to travel. I’ve lived in Edinburgh for over 10 years and think this is the most wonderful city. My fiancé and I love hosting and look forward to welcoming you to our home.
I am an easy going and friendly person .Believe on to prove my personality with my action .I love to chit chat and have fun with friends.

Hi, we’re Gill and Colin, your hosts. We have created a beautiful wooden cabin in a private space in our garden. We’ve travelled a fair amount, and are now settled in Edinburgh with our two kids and Labrador. We hope those travelling from near or far can create some great memories of Edinburgh and it’s surrounds while staying in the Cabin.

Hello.  I've lived & worked professionally in Edinburgh all of my life so I know it very well !  I have been hosting for over 5 years and really love being an ambassador for my City.  I've prepared a folder with lots of interesting walks, places of interest and recommendations for eating/drinking. Happy to give any advice needed.

I've lived in Edinburgh for the last 7 years and have also lived in France & New Zealand. I currently work for the NHS and spend my free time cooking, eating, swimming and walking, and exploring the beauty of Edinburgh whenever I get the chance.

We're a youngish couple in their 40s. We travel a lot, renting both our 2 bedrooms when we are away and only our spare room when we are around.

The green room is our library room with a cosy king-size bed, a bedside, a desk and a small shelf already there for you. 

The blue room is our master bedroom which is big and has a beautiful view.

We'll provide complimentary tea bags and we really hope you will enjoy your stay in our home sweet home.

Hi, I'm Aria. My family and I love to travel, having explored over 28 countries. Through our journeys, we’ve learned the deep comfort of a home away from home, filled with warmth and thoughtful touches. 

As a host, my mission is to share that very feeling with you. I'm dedicated to providing a cosy and truly memorable experience, ensuring your stay is filled with joy and relaxation.

We’re so happy you’ve chosen us. Enjoy every wonderful moment!
I am from scotland live near the beach in edinburgh like travel and foreign films and cooking

I'm a young Catalan lad, very open and friendly, and specially very adventurous: I hope I am able to visit as many places as possible in this big world. So far I have been able to visit China, the US (where I lived for half a year), Canada, and many European countries. I always feel it's not enough! :D

I specially enjoy Airbnb stays where there's more than a simple exchange of sleep place for money: when hosts are available for meeting and showing you around is when you get the most of a visit. Local people make you feel local. That's my travel phylosophy, and I hope it's yours too if I'm sending you a request ;)

Hi I’m Christopher. I’m Edinburgh born and raised but spent most of my adult life down in London Town. I illustrate children’s books and work as printmaker using woodcut/linocut. I’m also involved in running four nursery schools across the city (family business). I love nature and taking the opportunity each day to to smell the roses and appreciate small wonders. ✨
Lawyer/Academic who loves to travel anywhere and everywhere! I am originally from the USA but Edinburgh is my adopted home where I live with my husband and two children.

Hi, my name is Alison. I got introduced to Airbnb from my love of travelling and meeting new people who are themselves travelling. Since it's introduction I've loved every place we have stayed and seen. I'm a busy professional working in a fast paced hospital and love any opportunity to get out of the city & explore new places. I love seeing new places, learning new things and of course fine dining. I'm pretty easy going, I like talking to people & am interested in almost every sport. The most memorable place I've ever visited was Machu Picchu traveling South America with my sister. So I guess I hope with Airbnb there'll be plenty more memorable places to both see, visit and provide to others. Thanks
I love to travel and in my spare time I love to cook and tend to the plants on my roof garden.

Hi there! I'm a mid-thirties professional who tends to spend my time camping in the Scottish wilderness with my dog or whipping up delightful baked goods in my kitchen. I've lived in four different countries and love to learn about new places and cultures.

Hi, I'm Pierson. Originally from the Wirral, I was based in London for many years (via stints in Paris, Odessa and Moscow) and am now fortunate to call Edinburgh home. While I love city life I also enjoy getting away from it all, most especially to the wilds of Scotland and Wales where the majestic landscapes never fail to enthral me.
Husband, father of three, actuary
We are Alex and Ailsa and we recently moved into our new flat so decided to put our apartment on air BnB. We love using air BnB ourselves and have both worked in the hospitality industry.

Hi,
My husband Scott and I are both from Edinburgh, Scotland. We love travelling and seeing the world and hosting people from everywhere. We look forward to welcoming you to the city and hosting you in our southside abode.  Please don’t hesitate to contact us for information or special requirements.
x

Hi guys! My name is Jan (Johannes Reinier is my passport name) and I live with my family in Uganda. I love outdoor sports and travel to remote mountain regions, most of the time a combination of these two. I work as an expedition leader, I've written guidebooks for hiking in places like Tajikistan and currently I help training hiking guides in the east of Uganda. Scotland remains one of my favourite places in the world and one day I'll move back there. If you need any tips on where to go in Scotland, just ask. I know every corner of the country.

If you are staying in my flat, I'll be happy to give sightseeing advice and answer any questions you have about the local area.

If I'm visiting your air bnb, I'll be travelling with my girlfriend. We like peaceful nature breaks and city breaks.

Bonjour! I live in a 2-storey flat in the heart of Edinburgh, just off Broughton street; it is a really good neighbourhood with bars, restaurants aplenty, a deli, Tesco express, John Lewis on our doorstep, and a stone-throw away from Carlton hill, the botanic gardens, George street, princes street, festival venues and the tram stop to and from the airport.
host in Edinburgh , will do my best for your stay
Love finding hidden gems throughout the world, whilst welcoming guests and helping them to do the same!

I’m Scottish and live in the Highlands with my Kiwi husband. We have 3 daughters who have all recently graduated from university and a miniature schnauzer called Bodhi. I enjoy tennis, cycling, skiing, yoga, running and walking and am lucky enough to live in a national park.
Hi there!

I like travelling, I had to travel between cities and countries, bcse of my work and family. I know how important is a good night sleep, little details in a room that could make all the difference. I was trained to pay attention to details, I hope I could help you to have a great time in our wonderful city. Any weather could be a gift, it changes Edinburgh, makes it different every day. For you to see it better, I'll share my knowledge w you.
Love to travel and explore the world.
Happily married Mother of two daughters Business owner .

Hi. We’re Jonny and Jacki, husband and wife. We rebuilt, installed and restored all of our properties to add subtle character and individuality while retaining originality and period features. The Crofthouse is our own holiday home in Harris and our pretty Edinburgh period listed colonies flat is our city home that we rent out to guests when we’re not there. 
The Bothy on Harris is a self contained tiny house made of larch lovingly furnished  in its own grounds at the crofthouse looking out over the sea.
I love my garden and a visit to the garden centre!
2 friendly and hospitable guys. Julio is from Madrid and Bruce is from Scotland. We both like Art, travelling, different cultures plus good local food and drink

Hi there!

We're GuestReady, a professional property management company helping hosts around the world deliver outstanding experiences to their guests.

We welcome all guests, prepare our homes for your arrival and will be available 24/7, should you have any questions or requests. From the second you book with us to the moment you check-out, we’re here to make sure you have a smooth and comfortable stay!

With our years of experience in the hospitality business, you can be assured of a fantastic stay at any of GuestReady's properties. We manage multiple properties around town, so if you're looking for something specific, do let us know and we'd be happy to help you find the perfect place just for you.

We're looking forward to meeting you and are always happy to answer any of your questions!

Warm regards,
GuestReady Team
Hello, just booked for my husband and his son to stay for his 60th birthday celebration as they go on safari from the UK

Hi, I’m Andrew

I’m a Superhost and former Formula One race car designer who’s lived all across Europe, and now hosts guests from my 1870s Georgian townhouse in Edinburgh.

Over the past 3 years, I’ve welcomed into my home over 150 guests from 28 countries, across 5 continents - including a few dogs along the way too!

Hosting for me is about trust, connection, and creating a space that’s warm, thoughtful and full of stories worth sharing!

I won't be around in person however Whistles & Willow my property management team, will be available 24/7 via Airbnb, email, or phone (do not text, please call) to provide any assistance you may need.

I and my partner are Architects and hence our environment has always been our top priority. We have lived in many unique places, most of which, we designed. We did not design western Harbour yet it has become our favorite place to live due to its unique character. This was our home and we have been reluctant to move from it. We love seeing the yachts race on the Forth and the shipping which enters the Harbour we can see from the flat. We are very enthusiastic about light and space all of which we can see from the penthouse.

Hi I’m Luca (Lutza) and I live in the picturesque seaside town of South Queensferry just outside Edinburgh. I live with my partner and our 3 year old daughter Emilie. We recently started hosting on Airbnb - we love travelling ourselves and are excited to get to know people and welcome you in our home for a few days :)
My house is centrally located, Only 20 minutes from the city centre by car and 30 by bus. If you are flying in to Edinburgh Airport the Aiport bus will drop you 4 minutes walk from my home.

I am French but have lived in Edinburgh for 25 years +!!! I felt in love with the city whilst travelling as a student and thought that one day i would live here. 10 years later, that just what happened, and I have stayed here since!

I am a scientist by training, but I love art, photography, yoga, cycling. I live with my partner Mel at his lovely home. Welcome!

A lover of books, of cycling and of singing. I work as a librarian and am fortunate enough to still really like my job.......how can I not when surrounded by books?! My favourite city is Rome.....though Bath comes a close second! A perfect day would involve reading, cycling and swimming and a  pint at the end.

Hi I am easy going and love travel and outdoor activities.

I am well traveled myself having lived in Scotland Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, the USA and Spain. I speak upper intermediate Spanish and enjoy meeting people from all over thew world.

These air be Air BnB experiences supplement my main activity Valencia Excursiones Club. To see a sample just put the clubs name into You Tube

Look forward to meeting you
Edinburgh local. Happy to share local knowledge if you require. I hope you enjoy it as much as I do. The Leith shore is a great area to visit.

I am from Edinburgh, Scotland and used to live in London so spend time there regularly. I have a lovely daughter who is usually in tow. I work in marketing and also work as a professional dancer, teaching salsa. Hobbies include dance, reading, movies, and travel.

Very chilled and easy going.  I've used AirBnb a lot as a traveler and have really enjoyed it.  My partner and I have recently moved to Edinburgh and we decided to share the extra room in our home on Airbnb instead of taking on a full-time roommate.  

I speak English, Spanish and Portuguese and I'm currently learning French and Welsh, so please feel free to speak to me in any of those languages but have patience with my French :)

We love to travel, hang out, watch movies, cook, go for drinks etc.  We both work full-time but are generally at home during the evenings cooking dinner and hanging out.  Feel free to ask us about local spots to check out and explore in the area. 

We hope to welcome you into our home soon.

I am a married mum of 3.
I am also a registered childminder so I am fully PVG checked.
I am a Disney fanatic dance mum who loves watching Netflix.

We've lived on our farm in Argyll for over 100 years and know the area well both on and off the beaten track.  We live an outdoor life and have many different animals on the farm.   Much of the furniture and furnishings are antique,  upcycled,  painted or in some way colourful.     We let our farm cottage, 4 quirky off grid huts by the loch and flat in Stockbridge Edinburgh to guests from around the world who we enjoy meeting, often time & again.
I’m Afshin

Hey! My name is Diogo!

I'm originally from Portugal but I have been living in the UK for a long time. I'm an artist and plant lover as you'll discover if you stay in my 1-bedroom flat in Leith! 

Hobbies include yoga, cycling, climbing and podcasts!
Loves to travel and explore.
Alan & Leanne

Hi All, 

I am an architect by profession based in Edinburgh. As an outdoor enthusiast, I always seek adventure and uncommon places to visit. My passions are travelling, trekking and reading. I hope that one day I will move to the Himalayas where I can spend all days wondering around and escaping the urban rush.
Tidy and quiet, sporty and keen on walking, cycling and running.

"18 Craigmillar Park is a Victorian town house nestling
in the exclusive suburb of Newington situated on
the Southside of Edinburgh in walking distance
from the city centre.The property has been beautifully restored and tastefully decorated offering comfortable surroundings for work or pleasure. All rooms have Wifi, internet smart TV, complimentary toiletries, tea and coffee making facilities.There is free 24 hour side street parking available. A ten-minute ride on one of the many buses that pass the front of the property, will take you to the heart of Scotland’s beautiful capital city.Conveniently close to the guesthouse is Cameron Toll Shopping Centre with an array of shops, cafés and a gym. The guest house is also well situated for Edinburgh University, The King’s Buildings campus, The Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh Hospital and various golf courses."

Hello! Welcome to Diamond Short Lets. My name is Bilal  and I am the director. Diamond Short Lets has over 15 years in customer service and our business thrives on making sure every customer has the most enjoyable experience whether that is a Solo traveller, contractor or families. Every property that Diamond Short Lets hosts is personally checked by myself to ensure a 5 star experience.  

We encourage contacting us directly for long term bookings which will earn you a discounted rate and repeat booking discount.
I've lived in Edinburgh for 40 plus years, I'm an international bridge player. I'm married with a 22 year old daughter.
I stay in Edinburgh with my wife and son, I love travelling especially on my motorbike,  meeting new people, cultures and experiences.

Hello I’m Rachel of Rachel’s Farm Luxury Escapes … we have created luxurious Edinburgh designer homes with hot tubs,  city loft apartments as well as 10 holiday homes / lodges w/ hot tubs in Stirlingshire. Whether it’s a cottage for 2 or a farmhouse for 12, we can host groups of up to 60 guests.  Indulge in our elegant interiors and cedar wood hot tubs. Rachel’s Farm is ready to welcome you! Visit us directly - Rachel’s Farm FK8 3NR
Love Rachel x

I am a very open friendly and professional person.  People say I am very positive and even inspirational.  I have had by own business for many years in the fashion sector and now I am a part time lecturer in Business as well as run my own business. I value my freedom, creativity and work with my intuition, I have a flexible approach to life and I am much more go with the flow. I love the arts, learning new skills, seeking knowledge and expanding my comfort zone and feel very comfortable and confident with myself; and therefore with others. 
I would want you to feel at home and relaxed whether I was there or not, just be yourself. I believe in trust and respect so treat others as you would like to be treated, and it seems to work for me.
film maker. environmental policy graduate. music lover. Earl Grey addict. outdoor swim enthusiast. trainee potter. amateur chef. friend to bees.

I love travelling and exploring new remote places, ideally in my car where i have many a times camped as well. I love airbnb and used it extensively in my recent 3 month solo road trip to Scandinavia. 

My interests evolve continuously.. but at the moment i love a cold dip in refreshing waters of a fjord after immersing in a wood fired sauna or a floating cabin… sipping freshly brewed coffee while attempting to sort the world through tech… or learning to dance tango in magical streets of Edinburgh :)

Hi, we're Dan and Sonya. We've stayed in literally 100s of AirBnBs around the world over the last 10 years and now have a chance to host our own. We think we know what it takes to make a good AirBnB property and deliver a great experience for guests. We hope you'll come to visit soon.

I am a freelance musician living on-and off in Edinburgh. 

When my work takes me travelling around the world, I want to share my place with others who can make the best of what the Edinburgh City Center has to offer.

David and I moved to Edinburgh from Seattle in 2020, and we love it! We have a teenage daughter, 2 cats, and a golden retriever. We love traveling in the UK and Europe, but also never get bored of exploring Edinburgh- truly our favorite city in the world.
I've been living in Edinburgh for over a decade and love this city. Happy to give recommendations for things to see and places to go! I also love travelling, art and music.

I travel for the cultural experiences - food, language etc.

As a host: I offer a bright, spacious room in a 2-bed flat. I live in the flat as well and so will be available to help with anything.

I was born and raised in Edinburgh so I know all the sights and fun things to do. I’m a big foodie so I can recommend the best places to eat and also the best spots for a wee dram (glass of whisky). I am a huge fan exploring and enjoying socialising with people from all over the world. I’m a kind hearted lady with that always wears a smile. Our house is full of friendly welcoming people from all over the world, come and stay with us you won’t regret it

I am a 27 year old Officer in the British Army serving with the Irish Guards in London. 
Rent out my flat in Edinburgh while I am away serving so please enjoy it and make the most of what Edinburgh has to offer. 

I am originally from Scotland and have two brothers who also live in London. 
Love of sports and animals: mainly Rugby and Polo. Have owned horses and dogs my entire life. 
Very easy going person and very tidy and respectful

I started with my own holiday apartment in Edinburgh in 2003. At the time I was working away on an accounting project and decided to let out my home. It was not quite so easy then or trendy but it worked for us. 
When the project was finished I decided to continue being in the holiday business. So I moved back to Edinburgh found a new home in 2005 and continued on the journey in holiday letting.
I enjoy meeting guests and keeping them informed about Edinburgh.  In general, I try to visit the main attractions and places of interest in and around Edinburgh so I am a member of Historic Scotland and The National Trust.
I spend my working and leisure time enjoying what Edinburgh has to offer which is a fantastic array of events, festivals, concerts, fine restaurants, theatre and outdoor space. 
For guests, the highlights are often :-
Edinburgh Castle with it's long and intriguing history but also the world famous Military Tattoo and summer concerts on it's esplanade. 
Holyrood Palace, a royal residence for centuries and still part of the Queens visits to Scotland. There is a new garden layout  being opened to the public this year. 
Arthur Seat is a beautiful park just perfect for relaxing, walking, hiking and viewing the surrounding Lothian countryside including the river Forth.
Along with enjoying the history of buildings and places,  I visit the festivals , theatres, concert and so on.
Edinburgh can keep me busy but I also enjoy travelling and seeing new places.
2020 is a trip to Lisbon, 2019 a trip to Kent both booked through Airbnb
I am happy to help the guests if they have any questions about Edinburgh and some questions on Scotland.

We are a retired couple who left our home countries nearly 50 years ago. Scott is the author of a number of non-fiction books, and Naoko a conservator of works of art on paper who has worked in Turkey, Nepal and Malaysia. Nowadays, we are usually tending our small organic farm in the foothills of the Himalayas or watching the rice grow outside of Ubud in Bali, but Edinburgh—where our extended family lives—is our home in the West.

Overlooked by the castle, and just up the street from Grassmarket, 313 Webster’s Land is about as central as you can get with almost everything within walking distance. If you want to go further afield, there are convenient buses going in all directions nearby. We hope that you will enjoy the unique culture of Edinburgh from its historical heart. 

This is our home when we are in Edinburgh, so please treat it as you would your own. Some of Edinburgh’s best pubs and clubs are only a short walk away, so we would appreciate you confining any partying to there.
